page.title: 18PARKS AND GARDENS
page.content: Hazlehead Park and Johnston Gardens. There are 2 delightful parks in the area. The smaller, Johnston Gardens, was gifted to the city in 1936, being formerly part of Johnston House estate . The gardens are beautifully laid out containing streams, waterfalls and pools with winding paths and rustic bridges. The park is popular with the elderly. The area occupied by Hazlehead park was granted to the burgh by Robert the Bruce in 1319 and was developed into the city's largest park in the 1920s. The maze,donated by Sir Henry Alexander in 1935,is ringed by extensive gardens including a delightful rose walk. Hazleheads other facilities include golf courses, rugby and football pitches, a children's zoo and adventure playgrounds. The park frquently hosts Highland games, Concerts and Traction Engine Rallies.
